--- Edward Alexander <edyhiphop@...> wrote:

> Sorry for saying a stupid question but what are
> caltrops?????And what are those small discs with
> very sharp edges?????(how are they called)
>  
> Edy

Caltrops are spikes placed/strewn on the ground to
impede/distract a pursuer, etc. The general shape of
"tetsubishi" ("iron diamonds") is a 4 pointed object
with the points such that if you throw them down,
there is always one point up and 3 points as a base.
Think of jacks, from the kids game, except sharper. 

The small discs with the sharp edges you refer to are
shuriken. There's several names according to the
shape, etc., and I'm sure one of our resident ninja
masters will pipe up and tell us, but I'm not sure
what all they are. I know under the heading of
"shuriken", you've got all sorts of shapes and sizes
of throwing knives, including the disc and star shaped
types.
